data.title: Nuvalent GAAP EPS of -$1.70
data.description:
• Nuvalent press release (NUVL): Q3 GAAP EPS of -$1.70.
  • Cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities were $943.1 million as of September 30, 2025. Nuvalent continues to believe its existing cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities will be sufficient to fund its current operating plan into 2028.
  • R&D Expenses: Research and development (R&D) expenses were $83.8 million for the third quarter of 2025.
  • G&A Expenses: General and administrative (G&A) expenses were $28.9 million for the third quarter of 2025.
  • Net Loss: Net loss was $122.4 million for the third quarter of 2025.
  •

data.title: Banco Santander-Chile Non-GAAP EPS of $1.76 beats by $1.12
data.description:
• Banco Santander-Chile press release (BSAC): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.76 beats by $1.12

  • Net interest income and readjustments (NII) accrued as of September 30, 2025, increased 16.6% compared to the same period in 2024. This increase in NII was due to higher net interest income due to the impact of a lower monetary policy rate on our funding cost, which fell from 4.8% to 3.8% in 9M25. As a result, the NIM improved from 3.4% in 9M24 to 4.0% in 9M25.

    .

data.title: LendingTree beats top-line and bottom-line estimates; initiates Q4 and updates FY outlook
data.description:
• LendingTree press release (TREE): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.70 beats by $0.54.
  • Revenue of $307.8M (+18.0% Y/Y) beats by $29.44M.
  • Variable marketing margin of $93.2 million
  • Adjusted EBITDA of $39.8 million.

  • Financial Outlook*

    Today we update our full-year 2025 outlook and provide the resulting implied performance for Q4:

    Full-year 2025:*

    • Revenue of $1.08 to $1.09 billion vs. consensus of $1.03B.
    • Variable Marketing Margin of $337 - $340 million
    • Adjusted EBITDA of $126 - $128 million

    Implied Fourth-quarter 2025:*

    • Revenue: $280 - $290 million vs. consensus of $265.74M
    • Variable Marketing Margin: $82 - $85 million
    • Adjusted EBITDA: $29.5 - $31.5 million

data.title: BP says progressing plans for 'significant' Bumerangue discovery offshore Brazil
data.description:
BP (BP) said Thursday it will move forward with plans to extract oil from the Bumerangue block in Brazil's offshore Santos basin after initial analysis supported earlier views that it holds a significant volume of liquids.

BP (BP), which has described the Bumerangue find as potentially its largest discovery in 25 years, said early analysis was "extremely encouraging" and indicates a very large hydrocarbon column.

BP (BP) also said the elevated carbon dioxide level in the reservoir could be managed; high CO2 content can potentially make a hydrocarbon field uneconomical to develop.

The company is seeking a partner for the block, in which it currently holds 100%, but a former chief of Brazil's Petrobras (PBR) has said the field's economic viability hinges on its CO2 content.

"Given the presence of liquids across the entire hydrocarbon column, the high-quality rock properties observed and BP’s extensive technology and deepwater developments experience, BP believes that the carbon dioxide in the reservoir can be managed," the company said.

data.title: Rithm Capital Q3 earnings and revenue beat, helped by mortgage platform growth
data.description:
Rithm Capital (RTM) Q3 earnings and revenue topped the average analyst estimates as its Newrez mortgage and mortgage servicing unit grew, helped by lower interest rates, and expenses declined during the quarter.

Q3 EPS available for distribution of $0.54, beating the average analyst estimate of $0.52, was flat with Q2.

Q3 revenue of $1.11B, topping the consensus of $1.07B, decreased from $1.22B in the prior quarter.

Included in net revenue:

  • Net servicing revenue of $314.9M, including $264.4M of markdowns on fair value of MSRs and MSR financing receivables, compared with $419.8M in Q2, which included $155.0M of markdowns.
  • Interest income of $453.8M vs. $478.5M in the previous quarter.
  • Net gain on originated residential mortgage loans, held-for-sale, climbed to $196.3M from $169.7M in Q2.
  • Asset management revenue of $84.9M vs. $95.0M in the previous quarter.

Sculptor Capital, Rithm's (RITM) alternative asset manager, had $37B of assets under management as of Sept. 30, 2025, including gross fundraising inflows of $1.4B during the quarter. That compares with AUM of $36B as of June 30.

Its Newrez unit's origination funded production volume of $16.4B grew 3% Y/Y in Q3. The mortgage and origination and servicing platform generated a 20% pretax return on equity of $6.2B of equity vs. a 19% pretax return in the prior quarter. Total servicing unpaid principal balance increased to $878B from $864B in Q2 and up 7% Y/Y.

Expenses fell to $938.9M from $951.9M in Q2.

Book value per share of $12.83 at Sept. 30, 2025, grew from $12.71 at June 30.

Rithm Capital (RITM) stock rose 0.7% in premarket trading.

"This quarter marks a pivotal step forward in Rithm Capital’s journey, driven by strategic acquisitions, platform expansion, and a disciplined investment approach, as we continue building a diversified, asset management platform," said CEO Michael Nierenberg.

In Q3, the company agreed to acquire Paramount Group (PGRE), an office property REIT, for ~$1.6B in cash, and Crestline Management, an alternative asset manager with $18B in AUM as of June 30, 2025. Closing is expected in Q4 for both transactions. 

Conference call at 8:00 AM ET.

data.title: Sirius XM Holdings Inc. GAAP EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.06, revenue of $2.16B beats by $20M

data.title: Phathom Pharmaceuticals beats top-line and bottom-line estimates; updates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Phathom Pharmaceuticals press release (PHAT): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.15 beats by $0.26.
  • Revenue of $49.5M (+202.8% Y/Y) beats by $2.51M.
  • As of September 30, 2025, cash and cash equivalents were $135.2 million. Net cash usage was approximately $14 million in the third quarter 2025, representing a 77% improvement from net cash usage of approximately $63 million in the second quarter 2025. Based on its current operating plan and projected product revenues, Phathom believes these resources will be sufficient to fund operations and achieve operating profitability in 2026, excluding stock-based compensation, without the need for additional equity financing.
  • Updated 2025 full year revenue guidance: Phathom updated full-year 2025 revenue guidance to $170 million to $175 million vs. consensus of $170.4M.

data.title: Allegro MicroSystems Non-GAAP EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.01, revenue of $214.29M beats by $3.55M
data.description:
• Allegro MicroSystems press release (ALGM): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.01.
  • Revenue of $214.29M (+14.4% Y/Y) beats by $3.55M.
  • For the third quarter of fiscal year 2026 ending December 26, 2025, the Company expects total net sales to be in the range of$215 million to $225 million vs $210.39M consensus. At the midpoint of this range, it implies growth in net sales of 24% year-over-year.

  • The Company also estimates the following results on a non-GAAP basis:

    • Gross Margin is expected to be between 49% and 51%,
    • Interest expense is expected to be approximately $5 million, and
    • Diluted Earnings per Share is expected to be between $0.12 and $0.16 vs $0.14 consensus
